snippet: John Farrell left Boston after the 2010 season, leaving behind  two starters who seemed ready to enter their prime. In his absence, the two — Jon Lester and Clay Buchholz — lost their way.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that when John Farrell left Boston Red Sox as pitching coach after 2010 season, team's two promising starters John Lester and Clay Buchholz lost their way.
lead_paragraph: John Farrell left Boston after the 2010 season, leaving behind  two starters who seemed ready to enter their prime. In his absence, the two — Jon Lester and Clay Buchholz — lost their way.

headline.seo: In Boston, John Farrell’s Return Gives Pitching Staff a Boost
headline.main: Two Young Boston Pitchers Find One Coach Makes the Difference
headline.print_headline: Two Young Boston Pitchers Find One Coach Makes the Difference
